channel.title: Battery Tut
channel.description: In this tutorial you will learn how to make a battery sig [b]step one[/b] make a page width 550 | height 150 [b]step two[/b] go to filter->render->clouds (it should look somthing like this) [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/grsdgrsg.gif[/img] [b]step three[/b] duplicate the cloudes once. and click view off on the first on k ;) now cut the middle out of the second one. now you should have somthing like this: [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/Untitled-3.gif[/img] [b]step four[/b] press CTRL + U and move lightness to [b]-44[/b] and click view back on the first on and it should look like this: [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/Untitled-2.gif[/img] now you can add things like [b]+[/b] and [b]-[/b] and change the color. heres the end result [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/end.gif[/img] credits: me

item.title: Battery Tut
item.dc:creator: @Winter_Ice Winter Ice
item.description:
@Winter_Ice wrote:

In this tutorial you will learn how to make a battery sig
step one make a page width 550 | height 150
step two go to filter->render->clouds (it should look somthing like this)

step three duplicate the cloudes once. and click view off on the first on k now cut the middle out of the second one. now you should have somthing like this:
step four press CTRL + U and move lightness to -44 and click view back on the first on and it should look like this:

now you can add things like + and - and change the color. heres the end result

credits: me

Read full topic
